localAddress.title: Client local address (local AMS NetID)
localAddress.description: The local address of the client

localPort.title: Local port
localPort.description: The local TCP port used to communicate to the device.

host.title: Device Address
host.description: The device address. It can be an IP address or a hostname.

port.title: AMS port (device PortNr)
port.description: AMS port of the ADS device. This is not the TCP port used but the setting usually known as PortNr.; the actual TCP port is adsRouterTcpPort.

netId.title: Device Net ID
netId.description: AMS Net ID of the ADS device.

timeoutDelay.title: Timeout Delay
timeoutDelay.description: Time (milliseconds) after connecting to the router or waiting for command response is canceled due to timeout

connectionCheckEnabled.title: Connection Check Enabled
connectionCheckEnabled.description: If true, the connection will be regularly checked for existing connectivity in the time interval as defined in the parameter connectionCheckInterval. Otherwise no additional connectivity check is run.

connectionCheckInterval.title: Connection Check Interval
connectionCheckInterval.description: How often to check the connection (in milliseconds)

connectionDownDelay.title: Connection Down Delay
connectionDownDelay.description: How much time should pass without response to mark the connection down (in milliseconds)

connectionStrategy.description: If a connection attempt fails, retries will be performed with increasing delay (waiting time) in between. The following parameters control how these delays behave.

initialDelay.description: Delay (waiting time) of the first connection retry (in milliseconds). For subsequent retries, the delay will be increased according to the parameter incrementFactor which has a default value of 2.

maxDelay.description: Maximum delay (waiting time) to wait until the next retry (in milliseconds). The delay (waiting time) for any subsequent connection retry will not be larger than this value. Must be strictly greater than initialDelay.

incrementFactor.description: The factor used to increment initialDelay up to maxDelay. For example if initialDelay is set to 1000 and maxDelay to 5000 the values for the delay would be 1000, 2000, 4000, 5000.
